New Records: Luka Doncic scored 27 points and recorded 13 assists in the game.
The Dallas Mavericks scored 21 fastbreak points in the game.
The Chicago Bulls shot 41.9 percent from the field and 28.6 percent from three-point range.
Key Match Events: The Dallas Mavericks went on a game-changing 17-0 run in the first quarter.
The Mavericks scored 13 straight points to open the second half, capped by a three-pointer by Klay Thompson.
Dallas held a 30-point lead at one stage in the game.
Pre-Game Insights: The Chicago Bulls were playing without All-Star Zach LaVine due to a adductor strain.
The Dallas Mavericks were without center Dereck Lively and forward P.J. Washington due to injuries.
Post-Match Reflections: The Chicago Bulls have now lost three straight games.
Dallas lost another big man, Daniel Gafford, after he was kneed in the thigh by Nikola Vucevic.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the first for the Dallas Mavericks after the opening week of the season.
The Mavericks' depth and ability to handle the Bulls' defense were highlighted as key factors.
Others: The first half was marked by a series of runs, with the Bulls starting strong but the Mavericks taking control late in the quarter.
The game saw a power outage delay in the third quarter but play resumed quickly.
